page.title: 16Brownie Pantomines
page.content: The first Brownie Panto's started in 1970 because Mrs.Anne Stewart and Mrs. Abraham wanted a change from native plays. The dresses were the same as now and they acted the usual fairy tales like Cinderella and Alladin. They Have always been held in the Vernon Institute and they were put on to entertain the over-sixties, but now it is for fund-raising. The plays have always been acted very well. Mrs. Stewart was never in any of the pantos in Saughall. The Mayor went every year to see them and sometimes the Sheriff did. It was Mrs.Abrahams idea to start the pantos and Mr. Murphy has always written the scripts. The pantos have a been held at Christmas, on the weekend of the Golden Link Party. There are normally 24 people in the plays.
